guide.introduction_rendered:
How to build a snake robot

Relevant parts
  • Servos,rubber bands, Servo brackets, Micro controller, batteries, Lego Wheels
Tools
  • Laser cutting facilities, soldering iron, and screwdrivers

parts.text: Servos,rubber bands, Servo brackets, Micro controller, batteries, Lego Wheels

lines.text: Design is key! Use solid works or Google sketchup to plan out the elements of your snake bot
lines.text_raw: Design is key! Use solid works or Google sketchup to plan out the elements of your snake bot

lines.text: The key is to mount the wheels on rubber bands to insure ground contact at all times
lines.text_raw: The key is to mount the wheels on rubber bands to insure ground contact at all times

lines.text: Cheap servos will work but  the stronger the servo the faster your snake will be able to move. This is because the limiting factor on robot snake speed is not the servo speed but the torque required to get accelerate to that speed.
lines.text_raw: Cheap servos will work but  the stronger the servo the faster your snake will be able to move. This is because the limiting factor on robot snake speed is not the servo speed but the torque required to get accelerate to that speed.

lines.text: Don't be afraid to add lots of batteries, weight is your friend on this robot. Not only do the servos use up all their stall amperage typically, but heavier snakes mean more wheel friction to help you move!
lines.text_raw: Don't be afraid to add lots of batteries, weight is your friend on this robot. Not only do the servos use up all their stall amperage typically, but heavier snakes mean more wheel friction to help you move!

lines.text: Lego wheels are the cheapest and best in size. I highly recommend using them.
lines.text_raw: Lego wheels are the cheapest and best in size. I highly recommend using them.

lines.text: The ribs can be band sawed and drilled from cheap abs scrap or if you want absolute quality, you can have them laser cut.
lines.text_raw: The ribs can be band sawed and drilled from cheap abs scrap or if you want absolute quality, you can have them laser cut.

lines.text: Sensors help detect obstacles and drop; I used 4 sensors, however, they are optional. The snake will move slowly enough that collisions are not damaging. As for body collision remember that a 12 segment snake (long body) will not collide with itself if no segment can bend more then 30 degrees.
lines.text_raw: Sensors help detect obstacles and drop; I used 4 sensors, however, they are optional. The snake will move slowly enough that collisions are not damaging. As for body collision remember that a 12 segment snake (long body) will not collide with itself if no segment can bend more then 30 degrees.

lines.text: Analog servos work as well as the digital but metal gearing is a must!
lines.text_raw: Analog servos work as well as the digital but metal gearing is a must!

lines.text: Coding the snake is very simple: a bent sine wave or a queue of cycling steering values will work very well
lines.text_raw: Coding the snake is very simple: a bent sine wave or a queue of cycling steering values will work very well

lines.text: I used an Atom Basic ARC-32 micro-controller but an Arduino would also suffice.
lines.text_raw: I used an Atom Basic ARC-32 micro-controller but an Arduino would also suffice.
